p: Scanning tunnelling microscope (STM) is an instrument for imaging surfaces at the atomic level. It was invented by Gerd Binning and Heinrich Rohrer in 1981. The good resolution for STM is at 0.1 nm lateral resolution and 0.01 nm depth resolution [ 39]. It can be used in vacuum, air, water, gas and various other liquids at temperatures ranging from near zero kelvin to over 1000 Â°C. The whole concept is based on quantum tunnelling.
